item.title: Python Blog
item.description: Python and R Studio are both really interesting and useful tools used to interpret data, make graphics, and create websites. One really cool feature shared between these two languages is their ability to be utilized simultaneously in one document. My goal for this blog is to demonstrate the use of both languages to render specific results of interest. library(reticulate) hello<-"I hope that you find" there= "this blog post interesting." print(r.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are two of the projects I have been working on: Project 1 Project 2

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: It is known that socioeconomic status (SES) is a decent predictor of health disparities in the span of peoples lives. There are a variety of mechanisms in the human body that cause this, for example a heightened or more burdened stress response pathway in the body is known to contribute to a variety of diseases such as diabetes, high blood pressure, and some cancers. In this exploratory data analysis I will be comparing two datasets to explore various relationships analyzing cancer cases, population, location, income, and rent costs in each state in the US.
